website_summaries.verdict: Available in many different patterns, this shirt is very soft, durable, comfortable, and warm.
pros: Soft shirt that is made to fit men of all sizes well, even those with broad shoulders
This shirt offers generous length on most men
Warm shirt, making it a good pick for winter months
Doesn’t shrink when washed and dried
cons: Design is a bit boxy on some

customer_reviews.title: Great Shirt, but Shrinks a Lot
customer_reviews.text: I really liked this shirt when it arrived. The size ran a little large - which I expected, so I ordered a size Large and it fit perfectly and was very comfortable. I'm only giving it 3 stars because of how much it has shrunk after a single wash. The attached photos show one that was unwashed and one that was washed - both size Large. I followed the washing instructions on the tag and now it's about an inch shorter, an inch narrower, and the sleeves are almost 3 inches shorter than its original size - I'm afraid to wash it again.
customer_reviews.author: J. Benkert

customer_reviews.title: Ain't for the skinny jean wearing boys.
customer_reviews.text: For people who says that this fit is too big. I don't know if what they want is a fitting polo shirt or something. This ain't for the skinny jean wearing boys. This is a mans shirt. I ordered a size smaller than what I normally used and even before washing it was somewhat fitting already. Now with just one wash its half an inch shorter on my arms and the shirt is too fitting for my liking. It also don't crumple easily. Used it for 4 days on a trekking trip in Durango and held well. Without any damage even after a rugged abuse. Summary: Buy your usual shirt size. Don't buy a size smaller.
customer_reviews.author: JC

customer_reviews.title: Broad Shoulders? This is the shirt
customer_reviews.text: I have very broad shoulders with a small gut. I'm 5'11 and 215lbs. This shirt was perfect in XL for me.This shirt fits perfectly. A little baggy around the midsection, just a little. Good arm length. Very Soft. It is not what I would call a skinny fit.
customer_reviews.author: Vince E.

customer_reviews.title: Buy grinch like-3 sizes too big
customer_reviews.text: While this is a good looking shirt, a gift for my son in law, after one wash the shirt shrank so much he couldn’t even put it on. To truly understand this you have to know my daughter. She obsessed over directions and rules. Cold wash, tumble dry low heat? If the tag said it, she followed it to the letter. It’s frustrating to buy what you think is a quality product only to have it rendered unusable so quickly. I wouldn’t buy one of these unless you line dry your clothes. Welcome to the 1960’s
customer_reviews.author: Jon

customer_reviews.title: I like this shirt
customer_reviews.text: I like this shirt! Husband thinks it's a dress shirt, but that's ok. It's well fitting and warm. He's a bit long in the arms but that is not a problem with this shirt. Didn't shrink in the wash either.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Worn 3 times and seams are coming apart
customer_reviews.text: My husband loved this shirt, but after only wearing it 3 times, the seam at the cuff and sleeve has a 2 inch hole.
customer_reviews.author: Frankenstein's Mom

customer_reviews.title: Is this a dress or a shirt?
customer_reviews.text: I really wanted to like this shirt. But the medium was way too big so I also got a small. The small fit my chest and shoulders but wow, it's about 3 or 4 inches longer than it should be and bows out at the bottom. Then to make matters worse, they only accept prime returns on the medium and not the small. What kind of nonsense is that? I've included a normal flannel shirt for comparison (its from Express, also size small)
customer_reviews.author: Ryan William Priest

customer_reviews.title: It should be 0 star
customer_reviews.text: I expected the shirt to be sold in pristine condition, neatly folded as you would expect a brand new product to be. Instead It looked like a shirt that somebody had tried on and placed in a bag all wrinkled up and unbuttoned. It will probably look good after washing and proper drying but It is the seller’s responsibility to sell a product in condition that can appropriately called brand new and unworn. Otherwise, buyer should be adequately warned.
customer_reviews.author: Nelson O. Ocampo

customer_reviews.title: Tall and skinny. The MEDIUM fits great.
customer_reviews.text: I’m a tall, skinny dude. I’m 6’1” and 160lbs. Have long, primate-like arms, and a thin waste (but large muscular chest 38”). I was worried about the medium fitting right. Let me set you straight. It fits perfectly, the arms are longer than you would think, and so is the middle of the shirt. It fits me great.,, maybe a wee bit too big for me.... but I don’t care, I usually wear a shirt under and sometimes a jacket over a flannel. It’s well made. It’s soft. And most importantly it’s warm. I was worried because the medium sized LT canvas JACKET was too short in the arms and waist. This shirt is not too short, it’s just right.
customer_reviews.author: Matt Hegedus

customer_reviews.title: Not as pictured
customer_reviews.text: The color and pattern is way different than the picture. I will add a pic to show the actual look.
customer_reviews.author: marlene

customer_reviews.title: Looks nothing like the photo
customer_reviews.text: I ordered the Cedarwood Plaid, which according to the photo looks rather vintage. The shirt I got was marked Cedarwood Plaid, but looks NOTHING like the photo. It has a pinkish hue all over it. This is going back.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew J. KeeganTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Different than the image suggests
customer_reviews.text: Product looks different from the image. The color is more of a halloween orange than it is a honey mustard yellow it appears here. As you can see in the image I posted, the logo is also different than it appears in the photo. It's on a very bright orange background and the logo itself is white, not black as shown. Having said that, it's good quality and I still like the colors - I am returning it since the size was much larger than I expected. I recommend you order in your size, don't go a size up expecting it to shrink (like I did) they seem to run large as is.
customer_reviews.author: Quailman

customer_reviews.title: Shrunk a whole lot!!
customer_reviews.text: Shrunk a bunch (especiallyin the sleeves), and started to pill after first wash. I ordered an XL Tall, and it is too small already. I'm 6'01" 210 and an XL Tall will usually work. Not impressed; especially after seeing all of the positive reviews.
customer_reviews.author: James E.

customer_reviews.title: Best flannel shirt I've ever owned
customer_reviews.text: I've had such abysmal luck with flannel shirts. About once every 20 years I'll find some good shirts, but I'm far more often disappointed. They shrink way down, or they wear out far too fast. I haven't had it that long, so I really can't speak of the longevity and wearability, but it's a great fit, it's very comfortable, and it looks great. Now when I say it's a great fit, I mean that it's a bit large. I ordered a size "large". But I know it's going to shrink a little. All shirts do. I'd say the sleeves are about 3/4" too long. I'm 5'-10.5" 190 lb. So now I'm going to immediately order one in a different color.
customer_reviews.author: Pat Traynor

customer_reviews.title: Shrinks A LOT
customer_reviews.text: Earlier I wrote how wonderful, soft and warm this flannel is. I bought it for my husband and it fit him perfectly. Unfortunately, after being washed and dried, it has shrunk so much it looks ridiculous. The sleeves are now 3/4 length and fits him too snug. Before I bought this flannel, we bought the tall version of it and that was too long. Maybe that would have been a better fit now since this flannel shrinks so much. We’re now past our window of returning this so we’re stuck with this I’ll fitting flannel. Super bummed
customer_reviews.author: Sara J

customer_reviews.title: Waaaay too big
customer_reviews.text: I normally where Large shirts when it comes to flannel/casual button downs as I have very long arms. I'm 6'2 170 so the issue I have is the width of shirts tend to be much larger than needed but the arm length is perfect when I get sizes like Large. I ordered a Large Tall as I've had success with that size in the past with other brands. A large tall was literally the largest shirt I've ever purchased lol. It was legit almost double my waist width wise. GET A SIZE SMALLER THAN NORMAL
customer_reviews.author: Andy Walsh

customer_reviews.title: Does not run true to size.  It is a tapered "athletic" fit.
customer_reviews.text: I really like the shirt that just arrived. Good quality, and looks good. Unfortunately, it is a tapered fit and does not run true to size. I wear a Large in long sleeve shirts. This was too tight around the stomach. I received a 5.11 shirt at the same time (large) that fit perfectly. I am returning this one and just purchased an XL.
customer_reviews.author: Livingthepast

customer_reviews.title: lighter than expected
customer_reviews.text: I have a legendary whitetails flannel shirt that is about 12-15 years old and love it. It is fairly thick material but not overly so and comfortable to boot. The fit and look of the new shirt is great. However, in comparing the two shirts, I found the material in the new shirt lighter, leading me to question it's warmth and overall durability. Time will tell. Fairly certain I could have purchased a similar quality shirt at around 1/2 the price and wouldn't recommend LW shirts at $30. Edit 1/27/20: After washing, the shirt shrunk substantially and the sleeves are approximately 2 inches shorter. I'm very disappointed with this order and would not recommend this shirt to others.
customer_reviews.author: breeblebox

customer_reviews.title: Waste of time and money.
customer_reviews.text: Ordered a 2x which was like a tent, and hung below my finger tips. Paid $6 to return on prime!?Then ordered an xl which is snug, can't win. Looks nice on opening but fear what happens in the washer. BIG disappointment. Another $6 return on prime? Garbage!
customer_reviews.author: Don

customer_reviews.title: Looks and Fits Great
customer_reviews.text: The fit: I'm 5'10" &190lbs average build. Typically order large sizes but this large is definitely a bit bulky. Considered returning it but it is 100% cotton and other reviews mention it shrinking some, I'll probably hang on to this to see how it shrinks up. The fit isn't bad as is. Great color and and contrast of the corduroy color (got the army green). Definitely another classic comfy shirt for the closet. Would instantly buy again (will probably buy another).
customer_reviews.author: Snave

customer_reviews.title: shrunken mass of flannel
customer_reviews.text: It was a disaster. I would never buy this product again. When it came I tried it on and the fit was loose and ample. The tags did not state "Dry clean only" or any other caution. When it came out of the wash it had shrunk horribly and was misshapen to the point that it was unwearable.
customer_reviews.author: David R. Hoffman

customer_reviews.title: This must be a second
customer_reviews.text: It could have been a beautiful flannel shirt. Too bad the plaid does not match. My husband says he feels like "a patchwork quilt". The lines in the plaid are terribly off--not closely mis-matched where the fault can be overlooked. Plaid is off at each side and on each arm. And, with this plaid? It really shows! He almost looks clown-like wearing it! XLT was a perfect fit. The material washes well: Did not shrink in warm water and medium dryer heat. Only needs a bit of ironing--if going out in public. But that won't be happening with this shirt! This can only be a wear-at-home shirt because of the horrible matching!
customer_reviews.author: I Do The Speed LimitTop Contributor: Cooking

customer_reviews.title: Buy a size smaller
customer_reviews.text: The sizing is definitely “off” I’m wearing a medium and it’s a little big. I’m 5’11” 185lbs and the medium is a little baggy but feels great
customer_reviews.author: Daniel Perrigo

customer_reviews.title: Great for layers of light jacket. Update, not preshrunk.
customer_reviews.text: I got the XL tall size because I wanted to wear it over top of a t-shirt or even another collared shirt. It is perfect like this but if you just want to wear it as a regular shirt I would size down. It’s quite well made, thick , soft & comfortable. Exactly what I was looking for. UPDATE: After a run through the dryer (thanks, wifey) the shirt shrank. Now it fits perfectly like a regular shirt. If you want it oversized as a jacket then either size up or always hang dry. If you want it as a warm shirt then just run it through a wash & dry to shrink it down.
customer_reviews.author: Mitchell Gross

customer_reviews.title: Size Large felt more like a medium.
customer_reviews.text: Just received this today after a long ship time. Color is beautiful, material feels like quality. The fit is horrible. I ordered a large tall and the fit is tight ( more like Medium) like they may have mislabled this or are using a different scale when producing this. I've purchased size larges at numerous places that fit me perfectly or at worst are a little larger than I anticitpated. This is sadly too small and if you wash it.....good luck. Amazon , although they list an exchange process, do not offer that as a "choice" on their why are you returning this item list. Customer service calling seems to be bogged down currently as well.
customer_reviews.author: B. J. Smith

customer_reviews.title: Fit is excellent for me - wide enough across the shoulders (I ...
customer_reviews.text: This is a quality shirt. Size XL. Fit is excellent for me - wide enough across the shoulders (I have broad shoulders) and the sleeves are long enough. Shirt is fairly long - I'll need to wear it tucked in. A bit large around the mid-section though that will probably not be an issue after a wash. I like it and I think I'd buy another.
customer_reviews.author: AlasCat

customer_reviews.title: Sizing is off
customer_reviews.text: Be careful with the sizing on these shirts. I typically wear an XL, but after reading reviews saying these run big, I ordered a L. Sadly, the L fits like a very big XL (too big for me). I really like the pattern and color of the shirt, so I ordered a M thinking that would be the perfect fit, but no. The M fits like a true medium and I couldn’t wear it. I’m really bummed because these shirts feel well made, but the sizing is too off to make it work.
customer_reviews.author: CJF

customer_reviews.title: Runs a little big but a good buy!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my husband, who is about 6’1” and around 165 pounds. Normally he wears a medium, but sometimes he wears a large (mainly due to his height and the length of the sleeves/torso). I read in these reviews that the shirt ran big, so I ordered his regular size medium. The reviewers were right! The shirt is a little in the big size, but it still looks great - especially as a mid-layer (which is what I kind of envisioned for this shirt when I bought it). The hubs really likes it, too, so that is obviously a plus! Would recommend and would buy again - it does run slightly big, though!
customer_reviews.author: Katie

customer_reviews.title: A Great Shirt at a Reasonable Price
customer_reviews.text: I’ve gotten flannel shirts by this brand before. They are excellent - they look good, they are soft and comfortable, and they are warm. They hold up for a long time despite my hard use of them and the buttons never come off. My only suggestion is that they make them somewhere other than China, which has so few freedoms for most people, and which pollutes the ocean with massive amounts of plastic.
customer_reviews.author: Jim S. Royer

customer_reviews.title: sizing varies with everyshirt
customer_reviews.text: Hi, this makes the third one I have bought for my hubby. They are great shirts, but I wanted to mention that all three of ours our Large Tall, but all three seem to fit differently, notable that sleeve length is different on each of them. This last one, is the shortest of all three, if there is shrinkage, it will be too short. I don't recall shrinkage on the other two, so it may be fine. We will see after a washing or two.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Size up. Will shrink
customer_reviews.text: Bought three of these for my husband. True to the colors. The only thing is definitely size up. He would normally wear a large, and that’s what we first ordered. But even after washing in cold and hang drying they still shrunk, so I ordered x-large and washed in cold and hung dry. Now they fit perfectly like a large would. He loves these. They are comfortable and thicker than a cotton.
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth Wainright

customer_reviews.title: Top quality, but runs a little large (& long for those who don't tuck in their shirts)
customer_reviews.text: High quality product, but it does run a little large and long. I'm not one for tucking in my shirts, but this seems to be made for people who do. I haven't tried shrinking it yet, but I may have to in order to get it sized better for me, as I ordered a small and it's still a little too big and baggy for my tastes. I'm about 5'10" and 160 lbs with a slim/athletic build. All that said, the flannel fabric is top notch, warm and comfy, and the corduroy reinforced collar and cuffs should hold up well. Stitching seems solid (except for one little seem on my left cuff). Great value, certainly worth the money paid.
customer_reviews.author: JesterGraphic

customer_reviews.title: All the colors are sized different 🤷‍♀️
customer_reviews.text: These are great shirts, my husband and I love them! He has redish one he loves, so I ordered him blue, grey and green all size large.. EVERY SHIRT fits differently. The grey one is great fits like his favorite one, the green one is close to the same size but the blue one is so off in sizing! It’s more like a medium than a large.. very disappointing to drop $100 on three shirts and only one be be sized right.
customer_reviews.author: Breanna

customer_reviews.title: Love this Shirt
customer_reviews.text: I love this shirt. Quality and color are excellent. I wear a 3XLT and I'm 6'3" tall, and a little pudgy around the belly. This shirt fits very well. It's warm, soft, looks great, and extremely comfortable. I've even slept in this shirt just to see how bad it wrinkles and surprisingly it was virtually wrinkle free. This shirt is fairly heavy and would be excellent for colder weather. I live in north Texas and it makes a great winter shirt for this area. In really cold weather it would make an excellent shirt layer. Nice shirt and I will certainly buy more of these.
customer_reviews.author: R. Brown

customer_reviews.title: Sweet looking flannel, might not be functionally for us workers, maybe this is strictly a hunting company
customer_reviews.text: I bought this flannel with high hopes, it’s warm, looks great, has a nice loose fit, the collar is courdoroy or something and it looks like it’ll actually keep its shape. My only gripe is the sleeves are very long for an XL. It’s finally starting to get chilly here and went to put it on this morning and realized the cuffs at the bottom of the sleeves only have one button. All my other flannels have two so you can adjust the tightness, without this feature these long sleeves are going to constantly be in my way. I just emailed the company and will update you on what their customer service has to say.
customer_reviews.author: Pete the Roofer

customer_reviews.title: Cheap
customer_reviews.text: Everything about it screams "cheap". The material is paper thin, it looked nothing like the picture, and the fit was way off. Extremely short, and the shoulders were far too narrow. The second button falls far too low as well, so you can either button it all the way up and wear it like a dress shirt, or unbutton the top button and look like a member of the Bee Gees. There is no in between. It reminds me of the Gordon Gartrelle shirt Denise made Theo in that episode of the Cosby Show.
customer_reviews.author: Han Solem

customer_reviews.title: Shrinks
customer_reviews.text: Very comfortable Flannel shirt and looks great wearing it. I think that it should be in the $20.00 range rather than $29.00. Quality should be better. Received shirt with broken button. There was an extra button sewen on the bottom of the shirt tail and I replaced it. Follow the washing instructions. Only wash in COLD water and line dry or AIR tumble in dryer. I purchased an X-Large shirt and washed in COLD water and tumbled dried in dryer "AIR DRY NO HEAT". My shirt still shrunk tail length and sleeve length. Shirt was a bit baggy and now it fits well. If I would have washed in warm water and heat in dryer it would not be wearable.
customer_reviews.author: Leonard S.

customer_reviews.title: I am unsure how to rate this shirt
customer_reviews.text: The shirt is nice, it's warm, and it looks good. But my problem with the product is a strange one. I ordered the large after reading some of the reviews. It actually fit exactly perfect. I am 6' 1'' 226 pounds and large is my size in nearly everything. As I said this shirt fit perfectly but, knowing that it's fleece, unless I baby this thing in the washer and never dry it in a dryer it'll likely be fine. I'm thinking I should've gone with the large tall, or maybe the XL. I'm starting to see why Amazon started the whole wardrobe thing.
customer_reviews.author: Dee El Mile

customer_reviews.title: shrunk almost two sizes!
customer_reviews.text: Washed it in cold water , dried it on low like the tag said. Shrunk too small to wear. Expected better, very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: D.W.

customer_reviews.title: VERY much too small after one washing
customer_reviews.text: I'm big, and tall, so I bought a 4XL Tall shirt. It was a little snug in the shoulders, but the sleeves were the right length. I wore this once, then washed it in cold/gentle and hung it up instead of putting it in the dryer. Now it is very very much tool small in the shoulders, and the sleeves are several inches shorter. It's completely useless now, and I'm out 30+ bucks. DO NOT buy this unless you are skinny and "normal" height. It's soft and heavyweight, so it would be a winter favorite if I could wear it.
customer_reviews.author: Florida Boxdog

customer_reviews.title: Horrible fit!
customer_reviews.text: While the quality isn't horrid, the fit absolutely is. How are these so highly touted? This is the worst-fitting button-up shirt I've ever worn. Ever. The sleeves are 1-2" too short. "Tall" sizes are not tall-- they're regular (and an ill-fitted regular, at that). Collars are ridiculously loose. All these demerits add up to a sloppy looking, uncomfortable shirt. For over $30! That's ridiculous. Knock-off, pop-up brands are better sized. Get it together "WhiteTails". *also, this one was made in China (I don't think sizing is dependent on whether China or India)
customer_reviews.author: MarcUsSp

customer_reviews.title: What changed?
customer_reviews.text: This was the third buck camp flannel I’ve purchased. I bought the solid green and another blue/orange/tan last year. I loved those so much, I came back for more this year. However, I’m not sure if I got a knock off or if manufacturing has changed. This years buck camp, while softer, is thinner material, smaller, and the buttons seem undersized for the holes and the shirt comes unbuttoned with any movement. Not sure what changed. I thought I’d found a steady wardrobe staple, but sad that quality seems to have diminished.
customer_reviews.author: BenCoffeed

customer_reviews.title: Great style, poor measuring
customer_reviews.text: Legendary Whitetails style is amazing. All about it. However, these shirts shrink a ton! Washed them in cold water as instructed, tumble dried on low as instructed, even tried hang drying one. The length comes up several inches and the sleeves are way too short, like wayyy too short. Not sure if it is the material or what, but I am a pretty standard sized dude. Maybe I should get a size up and purposely shrink it down to normal...
customer_reviews.author: Daniel Griffin

customer_reviews.title: Shrinks!  Maybe worth it if you buy 1x up from normal but that's risky!
customer_reviews.text: Fit great when new. I loved it and had another in my Amazon shopping cart but waited to see how it stood up to washing. It shrunk like crazy! Sleeves were like 6" too short. Washed it in cold water and tumble dried it on low, just like the label instructed. Not sure how other reviewers could say it didn't shrink unless the manufacturer stopped making them with pre-shrunk cotton or since then.
customer_reviews.author: Annonymous

customer_reviews.title: Legendary Whitetails Men's Buck Camp Flannel Shirt great shirt
customer_reviews.text: After a good deal of research and a few orders of other flannel shirts and not finding a shirt that is heavy enough, I found this shirt on Amazon. I've been looking for a medium weight shirt to use while working outside. This shirt meets all of my needs, comfortable, excellent fit, proper weight for abrasion protection and works to mitigate dropping temperatures. The one caveat is the shirt is so nice I will have to order a few to wear other than to work around the yard. You won't be disappointed if you buy this shirt.
customer_reviews.author: Mel Laughton

customer_reviews.title: Not all sized the same
customer_reviews.text: So I ordered 3 of these shirts: great quality- prob nest flannel for the money. I am 6’2 and 270lbs so I ordered XXLT - plaid shirt fit great! The 2 solid colors were smaller in every detail: arm length neck size etc Unfortunately I ASSUMED that once I tried in the plaid shirt all was good- but not the case. I washed them, hung them to dry and then short tumble day after. I now own two small solid colored shirts that don’t fit well. Won’t do that again. so make sure you try on everything from this vendor.
customer_reviews.author: Doormann51

customer_reviews.title: This will shrink
customer_reviews.text: I washed on cool, let air dry and the garment still shrunk. This was by far my best fitting shirt until I washed it for the first time. Its a shame, it seems to be made of great quality and good materials but I can't have a garment that I have to take special care of for it not to shrink. None of my other button up shirts behave this way. Maybe I should have washed it on cold instead of "cool" but really this is inexcusable. You have to assume customers are going to wash their clothes.
customer_reviews.author: Dan P.

customer_reviews.title: Really wanted to like it????
customer_reviews.text: I wear XL and it is always a little loose (don't like tight clothes) this actually fit but it was tight on the shoulders and upper arms. I am not big but in decent shape so I am disappointed that it seem its made for skinny guy w little muscle. Also they charge 6.95 for a return fee but state they want their customers to be satisfied. If there was no charge would have tried the XXL but would be afraid the body area would be to large. Oh well it really seems like a really nice shirt but not for my body.
customer_reviews.author: Mikey  R

customer_reviews.title: Ask for size chart & you must pay for return shipping costs....
customer_reviews.text: I'm actually returning the item and it is going to cost me money to return it. The information says free returns but keep in mind, you have to pay for shipping. I would also would ask for a size chart before you purchase this item. The quality of the shirt looks great. I just wished it fit.
customer_reviews.author: Unpretentious Geek

customer_reviews.title: Excellent shirts, run a bit large
customer_reviews.text: I really love this shirt. It took me a couple tries to find the right fit, and unfortunately Amazon charges return shipping for these shirts for some reason, even with prime, unless you want to schlep them all the way to an Amazon bookstore location. I wouldn't buy clothes on Amazon if I wanted to go to the mall. I'm 6'3" 250 athletic/muscular build and normally wear either a XXL or XLT... however in these a LT was the best fit. Sleeves are just about perfect, but shirt length is maybe just 1-1.5 inches to long. Very comfortable material and looks great. I bought a few more directly from the companies website.
customer_reviews.author: Charlie Foxtrot

customer_reviews.title: Paid for a new shirt but got one that had been washed
customer_reviews.text: When you order and pay for a shirt from Amazon, you expect the item you receive to be new. Instead I got a shirt that had no tags on it and had obviously been washed. As soon as I took it out of the bag I could tell just by looking at it, but then I could also smell the fabric softener. This shirt was supposed to be a Christmas present for my son. If I gave him this, it would be as if I pulled it out of my closet and wrapped it. I'm returning and reordering and expecting a NEW shirt this time.
customer_reviews.author: Jane Donut

customer_reviews.title: Looks Okay but Quality is Lacking
customer_reviews.text: I can usually wear a medium but ordered a large. Everything fit as a medium would but even sizing up, the sleeve were still at least an inch short. Material was heavy but the overall quality was not very good. The weave of the fabric causes all the edges to twist and stick out. The cuffs and collar were the worse. Comes out of the dryer wrinkled, which it should not for a flannel shirt. It _looks_ like a good shirt but the quality is lacking.
customer_reviews.author: Todd Copeland

customer_reviews.title: Well-made soft flannel shirt/jacket; true to size
customer_reviews.text: The sizing was accurate and the texture of the shirt/jacket is adequate for a cool and damp climate. The length is quite long and will cover any items like gps units and cell phone or digital cameras whilst one is in the field. This is a very good product. I have had little occasion to use the shirt on a daily basis until summer turns into fall. Thank you for excellence. The difference between 4 and 5 stars will be determined after light laundering and drying; I do not expect the garment to lose much of its original size.
customer_reviews.author: Howard Hayden

customer_reviews.title: Looked great until you washed it
customer_reviews.text: Even following the care directions the shirt came out with pills everywhere, especially under the armpits. This makes me worry that this shirt will continue to wear poorly. Its tight in the shoulders and the sleeves are extra long (even though I bought a tall). So overall, shirt that looks good until washed, but the cut is weird as well. Unfortunately I didn't wash and wear it until the return window closed or I would have returned it.
customer_reviews.author: Jason O

customer_reviews.title: Does shrink, but if you order accordingly it’s perfect!!
customer_reviews.text: My husband is 6’1” and around 220 lbs. He normally wears a large in shirts but XL works better in the shoulders on button downs because his are broad. We ordered an XL Tall and washed and dried it one time...it shrunk up to the perfect fit. I’ll probably hang dry it from here on. The fabric is thick and warm... it feels like very nice quality. We also love the fact that they reinforce the collar. Just overall a quality brand.
customer_reviews.author: Nichole

customer_reviews.title: Great to start, Was disappointed in the end
customer_reviews.text: I only gave this 3 stars because they shrink so much. They look great, feel great, and fits great until it’s washed. It was washed in cold water and dried on low heat for 10 minutes to take out the stiffness and release wrinkles. That’s it and the shrinkage was very prominent. I had ordered 2 of them, so my husband will just have to wear them around here to work in. All I can say is order at least 1 size bigger than you need. I don’t know if I’ll try anymore of them or not.
customer_reviews.author: Susie

customer_reviews.title: It Shrinks so much that it is Unwearable!
customer_reviews.text: It shrinks so much that it is unwearable! I washed it in cold water and dried it on low heat, just as it said on the label. The sleeves shrunk at least 4 inches and it shrunk so much around the chest that I could not wear it!. I would not buy this shirt again!
customer_reviews.author: Bohdi Sanders, Ph.D.

customer_reviews.title: Won’t order again
customer_reviews.text: This is nearly the same shirt sold with snaps, but for some reason it has not shrunk as much and the fit is not tight. Both types are 3xl, while my actual size is XL. At least the 10 year old inexpensive shirts still fitting me are XL. I can still wear this button version of the shirt. I really wanted snaps, but could make do with this one if it didn’t shrink and if I didn’t have to order such a big size. This is a recent tendency among all Asian made brand western shirts.
customer_reviews.author: J. Calhoun

customer_reviews.title: It's not a tapered slim fit...
customer_reviews.text: ...and that's just what I wanted. While I am not morbidly obese, I do have a bit of a ponch, and this shirt looks and feels awesome! This particular plaid is incredible, too. When I wear this shirt it makes me feel good about the way I look. I looked for a flannel shirt instead of a fleece shirt because most fleece shirts are polyester, and I wanted an all cotton shirt. It looks good, it is very comfortable, what more could anyone ask?!!!
customer_reviews.author: Positude

customer_reviews.title: unacceptable.
customer_reviews.text: After 2 cold washes it shrunk. The arms are now too short. The collar is sewn improperly causing it to fold up, an iron and starch took care of that until it shrunk.
customer_reviews.author: Jamie

customer_reviews.title: One normal wash and it shrunk
customer_reviews.text: Washed for husband to wear for first time after try on, and normal wash and normal dry shrunk the arm width and length.... New shirt unable to be worn. Very very disappointed!!!
customer_reviews.author: Chelsie Hutchison

customer_reviews.title: Nice Fitting Shirt
customer_reviews.text: I am 5' 10" and 215 with a bit of a belly. I ordered a large (and normally wear a large) and it is a perfect fit. The top of collar to bottom is 32 1/2 and pit to pit was 24. Made in China version. The flannel is soft and of medium thickness. Hope this helps.
customer_reviews.author: E. S. PECK01

customer_reviews.title: Shrinks a lot in width
customer_reviews.text: As I understand from other reviews, sizing can be inconsistent from batch to batch. The shirt that I got (size Medium) fit near perfectly before washing, but shrunk a whole inch in width, including shoulders, after the first wash. It was pretty narrow in shoulders to begin with, and after having been washed it's now uncomfortably restricting in the shoulders. Looking at the sizes table, it seems like that the next size up would be too large, even after washing.
customer_reviews.author: AN

customer_reviews.title: Super comfortable, but this flannel breaks down quickly.
customer_reviews.text: As with the other one I bought the overall build quality is good and the materials are very soft and comfortable. I'm only missing the second set of cuff buttons. -Update: I reduced my rating because three months after my purchase and wearing it biweekly the button placket is frayed on the inside and failing. At first blush it seemed high quality but this weave is not strong enough for the long haul.
customer_reviews.author: William H

customer_reviews.title: Soft flannel shirt
customer_reviews.text: I ordered the solid green color and it fits great. I received multiple compliments on the look and feel of the fabric. I did receive two identical shirts with my order. Nothing i see on the item's page/description says anything about two shirts for the price; however, it the order summary clearly showed two shirts were included. It makes for a great price for two well-made shirts, but it would have been nice to know it was for two and even have an opportunity to select a different style/color.. now I have two nice but identical shirts to wear.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Product - Very Large Fit
customer_reviews.text: This shirt looks amazing and feels amazing. It looks very fine crafted, regardless of where it was made. My only complaint is that I had to order a flannel before this one to figure out what my size is for this company. I'm 6'3", 315 lbs. I normally wear 3XLT, to accommodate my broad shoulders and long torso. I ordered the shirt in this size but it fit more like a 5XLT. So I reordered an XLT. It fits perfectly: loose enough to be comfortable but with more of a fitted look. -1 star for the sizing issue. The company could easily address this issue by changing the sizes to reflect the actual size.
customer_reviews.author: JD Fernandez

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: I really wanted to like this shirt, but I don't. The fit is just...weird. Arms fit good, waist is good, but it's something about the way it sits on my shoulders. It's like the collar/neck/shoulder area is way to big for the rest of the shirt. Sorry if that is about as clear as mud, but it's the best way I can describe it. I feel like I am constantly adjusting, pulling, and arranging the shirt because it feels uncomfortable all the time.
customer_reviews.author: RedDog

customer_reviews.title: Pure Garbage
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this shirt based upon ratings - I need a work shirt that fits and wears well. This does neither. I normally take a medium or occasionally large size. I ordered a large Legendary shirt only to find that it fits like I'm wearing my son's shirt. It's tight, the sleeves are short and after one washing it looks bad. The buttons are coming off and the fabric pils. Pure garbage. Don't buy this shirt.
customer_reviews.author: Frank Muschetto

customer_reviews.title: Better than any other retailer
customer_reviews.text: Back about 10 years ago, some of America's biggest retailers began hiking prices while coming up with new materials -- old ones, really, just nylon or polyester with a three digit price tag. So I've been looking for a good quality flannel shirt, and finally I found this. I can retire all my plaid Eddie Bauer and L.L. Bean shirts, because this one fits better than any of them -- and it's exactly the style I want. Comfortable, exceptionally well made, and durable: I'm going to stick with this shirt for a long time.
customer_reviews.author: Emmett H

customer_reviews.title: Great Shirt
customer_reviews.text: This was a Christmas gift to my brother last year. Here he is making sure the sleeves fit, because he does have long arms. The shirt actually has more blue to it which disappointed me, but my brother loves it. And I do have to say the blue probably brought out his lovely blue eyes. He lives in another state, so I have never actually saw wear it.
customer_reviews.author: Laura L.C. Karles

customer_reviews.title: Made in China; shirt I recvd labeled MD was not a US Medium; neck size was 18 inches
customer_reviews.text: The shirt appeared as I had hoped and the material felt like a soft flannel as advertised. However, even while still folded and in the packaging, the neck looked oddly large. I ordered a size medium and examined the shirt labeled which is "MD". I expect a neck size of 15-15.5 inches in a non-dress shirt medium. The collar of this shirt measures 18 inches (from center of the collar button to the center of the collar button hole). The appearance when worn is ridiculous. I am returning it.
customer_reviews.author: Otto

customer_reviews.title: Good quality, very comfortable, thick
customer_reviews.text: These shirts are really well made. They are thicker than most and very soft, so they make for really comfortable camping / outdoors shirts. The colors are very nice looking and masculine with lots of options. My only knock is that they do run a little bigger, so keep that in mind. I wear a large in everything but these shirts apparently, so I’ll have to exchange the 3 I bought for Mediums. I suspect this may be intentional so that you can wear an underlayer beneath them, but I don’t intend to do that with them.
customer_reviews.author: Zzz

customer_reviews.title: Not bad, but fit is bizzarre.
customer_reviews.text: High quality but the fit is awkward. I normally wear a Large (5'11/170lbs) but I got a Medium based on the reviews. The medium was way too large for me and the fit is really boxy. If prefer the boxy (classic) fit, you'd probably like these. Just get one or two sizes smaller than you think you need.
customer_reviews.author: Mark

customer_reviews.title: Not worth the premium price.
customer_reviews.text: Based on the reviews I ordered a medium since readers indicated they run on the large size. Turned out the medium was too small. So, I exchanged it for a large. Amazon charged me $7.00 for the return. Not sure why but they did. So I not have an even more expensive shirt. The quality of the shirt is ok, but good enough to justify the price. I won't be buying any more apparel from Amazon since they have changed their return policy.
customer_reviews.author: Bob

customer_reviews.title: Favourite Flannels
customer_reviews.text: I bought one of these a couple of months ago, and loved it so much I had to have another. That said, the first one was made in India, and my most recent one in China. I only mention that, because according to some reviews there is a difference in quality. While there are slight differences in the shirts' construction, neither is poor quality. Both of these are great shirts, and I'll likely return for a couple more.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff

customer_reviews.title: Great start, very bad finish!
customer_reviews.text: A terrific looking mid-weight cotton flannel shirt, nice feel, generously cut, good weight and apparently well made. This was before the shirt was washed, the 1XLL is now an M with 35" sleeves. The shirt has shrunk 20% in all dimensions and is wrinkled to boot. Should have worn and washed the shirt a couple of weeks ago and sent it back, my bad. This could be a great shirt but only a real disappointment! Fair warning...
customer_reviews.author: KirkFL

customer_reviews.title: Nice Shirt
customer_reviews.text: Awesome flannel shirt. This is a nice, light weigh flannel shirt. Its great for moderately cold weather, 40F-60F with out an under shirt. for weather cooler than 40F, Id recommend adding a base layer underneath it. It's made of cotton so its very soft and its not too hot like polyester or wool flannel. The cudoroy collar is a nice touch and the shirt is well made with he pocket and pen slot. Nice thing is that it comes in a variety of colors.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Large Runs A Little Small
customer_reviews.text: I'm 6'4", 220# with a slim build. I'm borderline L/XL but most of my shirts are L and I don't like my shirts to be tight. I would say that a L in this shirt runs a little snug but it's the arm length that's the problem. The arms are shorter than most any L shirt I own, about an inch above my wrist bone. I'm debating on replacing it with an XL Tall or just an XL. I'll update when it get the larger replacement.
customer_reviews.author: SaltySailor

customer_reviews.title: great shirt. warning: fits large
customer_reviews.text: nice soft thick fabric. great colors. fits big. i've taken mediums all my life. this is a very big medium. the sleeve length fits but the size of the arms is for either a fat person or a bodybuilder. i do not have skinny arms. also the torso fits like a barrel. check the company sizing charts and see if they give measurements. i'll probably buy another one but only after checking to see if the small would fit me better. on the other hand, if you want to wear this as a jacket the extra size might be useful.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher M. Porro

customer_reviews.title: Nice pattern, decent quality.
customer_reviews.text: The item shipped quickly and was securely packaged. Have only washed and worn once but appears well made, no evidence of shrinking (did not measure) or fading with cold water wash and drying in dryer. Comfortable fit and feel; I prefer roomy shirts and most often don't tuck in casual wear (though I'm sure it would look fine if you did). This was the Cobalt Plaid, will probably order the Buck Camp Flannel Shirt in Canyon Plaid as well. Looked at the Trailblazer Thermal Waffle Lined in Liberty Plaid but don't care for a velcro pocket closure. This one is quite nice. Got compliments.
customer_reviews.author: TheBeastNme

customer_reviews.title: Sleeves are comically short
customer_reviews.text: You’ll want to keep your arms down by your sides when wearing this shirt b/c the sleeves are comically short. Before washing everything fit well, but after one wash the shirt tightened up a bit and the sleeves shrunk at least an inch, maybe more. It’s a comfortable, well made shirt but don’t plan on wearing it out of the house. The issue with the sleeves is just too much to rate this shirt as anything other than an in house lounging shirt. It’s too bad b/c in every other way this is a well made and comfortable shirt.
customer_reviews.author: MBH

customer_reviews.title: Shipped direct from Seller - NOT Amazon Prime - reminder to read before ordering
customer_reviews.text: I overlooked (giving benefit of doubt!) that this was a ship direct from Seller. I ordered smaller than usual, my poor decision. However, now I am having to pay $3.35 return usps postage. Yes, I accept responsibility for making this mistake. After 11-12 years Prime member Amazon, if I only make this mistake once - like now! - I will have learned my lesson. Here's hoping. Just the same...not happy :(
customer_reviews.author: LindaM

customer_reviews.title: Ordered a 2X and the sleeves were literally 8" too ...
customer_reviews.text: Ordered a 2X and the sleeves were literally 8" too long and the wrist opening was a full 2 inches too wide around, as if I had Hulk hands or something. I had to take it to to a tailor and spent more having it remade to be an actual 2X (had to cut off the sleeve placket, shrink the circumference of half the sleeve) than I paid for the shirt. That being so, it's a nice-quality shirt and super-warm on cool/cold days, but I probably should have sent it back once I saw how ridiculously long the sleeves were, except that an XL would not have fit properly everywhere else.
customer_reviews.author: HolyGrail

customer_reviews.title: Save your money.
customer_reviews.text: If you ever owned Carhartt k87 t shirts...these are thinner. I wouldn't even classify these as a flannel shirt. Flannel shirts should be thicker and warm for cooler months. This is more of a flannel style dress shirt. Hipsters will love it, working folk or hikers, not so much. It's a shame too, because there are many very nice patterns, just a waste of my time. Even the corduroy was thin AF. I've never seen corduroy that thin in my life. The CQR are not any better. I bought one of each as a test to buy more of the one I liked most and returned both. For the money, there are way better options.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Quality and warmth
customer_reviews.text: We needed this shirt for warmth since we are from the south and was visiting the north when colder weather started. Ordered this flannel because it is hard to find big sizing just anywhere when traveling. It was convenient to get and was a real surprise for the excellent quality of the material it’s made of. Very well made with extra intricate details for warmth. Love the quality and price . All excellent , I will be looking for more items from this company . Thank you very much for your excellence in this product. I would recommend this product item.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: not for me
customer_reviews.text: returned it immediately. the inside is white, which doesn't work if you hunt white tail deer and may ever unbutton or remove shirt. Also, I was hoping for a chamois type material with some thickness. this is really thin which is good if you hunt hot climates, but isn't what I'm looking for. Fine product for some people in some places, but not worth anything to me for white tails in new England.
customer_reviews.author: Mike Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Very Short Sleeves
customer_reviews.text: I am 6 feet tall, and weigh 180 pounds. I bought a medium. The shirt fits perfectly, except for the sleeves. They are ridiculous. They barely go 2/3rds of the way between my elbow and wrist. This is definitely a product problem, I rarely encounter this problem with other shirts. Otherwise, the product seems to be quality made, And has a nice look and feel. But the sizing kills it.
customer_reviews.author: Kirk Lott

customer_reviews.title: Great Shirt, but...........
customer_reviews.text: Great shirt, but no sooner did I get it, my other half confiscated it as her new lounge gown. How do ya like that? $35 shirt and I don't even get to wear it. I get to watch her walk around barefoot all night wearing my shirt. Oh well.... Small price to pay for keeping the peace. She looks better in than I do anyway. Let me rephrase. She looks sexier than I do wearing it. lol
customer_reviews.author: Slow-N- Low

customer_reviews.title: beautiful shirt
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my son... he is 6' 2" and 250 lbs. I bought the 3XL. It fits great. The shirt is very soft. Great quality. The brown corduroy around the next, collar), and the cuff area of the sleeves looks very nice. He can roll up the sleeves and that corduroy is very nicely done. Fits him perfectly. Legendary clothes are great quality, last forever, hold their color, shape, non-fuzzy.
customer_reviews.author: 2 plus mom

customer_reviews.title: Super comfortable
customer_reviews.text: I wear this shirt a lot. I'm actually wearing it right now. Writing a review as I find myself on the item in my history deciding on a new color to order a second one. I got an XL, my usual size at 6' 2", 225 lbs. The sleeves are a bit short but I have longer arms than normal and I always roll the sleeves up anyway so no big deal. 4 stars for that and it is a little baggy over all with a wide and deep collar. I'd prefer a more tapered fit but that's just personal preference. For what it is, a quality material, soft, warm, boldly colored flannel shirt it's honestly a home run.
customer_reviews.author: Terrence M.

customer_reviews.title: Nice heavy flannel shirt
customer_reviews.text: This is a VERY warm, medium to heavy weight flannel shirt. The material is super nice and very soft. The cut, fit and craftsmanship seem to be worthy of the $30 price. It washed well on cold, but I hung to dry just in case it might shrink. He wears a large in everything and this fit as expected, with just enough room to allow for clothing underneath. This is his overshirt for when it's cool but not too cold. Very satisfied with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: x

customer_reviews.title: Nice but...
customer_reviews.text: Unfortunately had to return but the shirt seemed to be of good quality. Heavier for colder weather. Fit well (XL Tall) but the sleeves were too short. My boyfriend has issues finding quality items. Our only luck has been with under armor and Carhartt but I was hoping to find something like this - nice/casual. He’s too “small” for big and tall, yet some XL tall items are too short in the arms.
customer_reviews.author: Carolynn

customer_reviews.title: Could have been a nice flannel
customer_reviews.text: Felt like it was at least a whole size too small than what it was labeled. Returned it. Didn’t have next size up then
customer_reviews.author: Zachary Rasmusson

customer_reviews.title: Nice.... but...
customer_reviews.text: I want to love this flannel. It looks super nice but the measurements are so off. The sleeves are about 2 inches too short. I’ve never ever worn a “Long” size but if they have it I’d get it in that size. I ordered a Wrangler flannel and it fit me just fine. Other issue I have with this product is it’s been washed twice and the threads are already coming undone. So in my opinion this product is overpriced for what you get.
customer_reviews.author: Brendan

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality unwearable after washing
customer_reviews.text: Made in China I normally wear a Large however base on the size chart I purchase the XL. Try on the fit was too large however after washing the size is too small. Secondly after wash the fabric loses its integrity and becomes unwearable in public.
customer_reviews.author: MadDog616

customer_reviews.title: Never too Old
customer_reviews.text: My husband is 74, and has always worn, to my chagrin, Banded Bottom shirts. He is short but has always been well proportioned, but he just felt more comfortable, hiding his little tummy with the Banded Bottom shirts. He's retired now and I thought I'd give it another try, well, this shirt knocked it out of the ballpark. He especially commented on how warm it is. He has worn it everyday since receiving it. The weight is perfect for wearing around the house. Yea! Finally, a new LOOK on the old man. Happy man.
customer_reviews.author: Kathryn P Green

customer_reviews.title: Should have been Legendary but quality held it back!!
customer_reviews.text: Overall: Nice looking midweight flannel and warm Pro: Fits as listed, warm, suprisingly heavier than expected Con: Sewing was not done well on left sleeve - the material roll over on the sleeve taper was not rolled over correctly. Material edge was left un-sewn so it started to fray after first wash. Not exactly Legendary in my view.
customer_reviews.author: Computer Junkie

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for Warmer Climates!
customer_reviews.text: The fabric is thin, but soft. Collar and cuffs have a thin corduroy lining. I’m happy about the lighter weight flannel because although it does get “cool” in Georgia, our heavy outerwear and flannels just don’t make it out of the junk closet anymore, which is just too bad. We’d lived in Minnesota and Michigan, and have North Face jackets, the double coat with the fleece lining, guaranteed to keep you warm up to 80 below, along with the warmest, ugliest Sorel boots ( although their new Joan of Arc boots are gorgeous. *sigh*)
customer_reviews.author: JDSteppenzyde

customer_reviews.title: Cut big to wear layered.
customer_reviews.text: Definitely a good quality from first touch. But its definitely cut big to fit over another shirt. I purchased a large because that's what fits me normally. This fits me like a normal extra large. I guess the idea is to wear it outdoors in place of a jacket with something underneath. Thats what I'll do but I'd rather have had it in a medium to wear with just an undershirt.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin Cross

customer_reviews.title: Too much shrinkage
customer_reviews.text: Do NOT order this product. I read all of the reviews and they talked about how it shrank 1 inch here and 2 inches there but they obviously don't live in a world with normal washers and dryers. My shirt shrank 5 inches in the sleeves and 6 inches in the length. I never got to wear it. What a waste. Just order another shirt and quit trying to figure out how much it may or may not shrink for you
customer_reviews.author: mike

product_meta.title: Legendary Whitetails Men's Buck Camp Flannel Shirt
feature_bullets: Contrasting corduroy lined collar and cuffs
Left chest pocket with pencil slot and button closure
Double pleat back for ease of movement
